text:
When a node is published which was already published before, the link attribute
is not copied to the live sitetree. That means if someone publishes a node, then
changes its link attribute, and then publishes the node again, the link
attribute in the live tree is not updated.

I have a simple patch for this which handles the link attribute similarly to the
visibleinnav attribute (which is copied correctly).
However, I think there should be a more generic way to copy all attributes,
maybe something like sitetreenode.takeAttributesFrom(anothernode).

Created attachment 14334
patch of AbstractPublication.java to copy the link attribute

This patch applies to lenya 1.2.x

(In reply to comment #0)

> However, I think there should be a more generic way to copy all attributes,
> maybe something like sitetreenode.takeAttributesFrom(anothernode).

there was a discussion about the sitetree API a while ago. it basically
suggested to use an existing API instead of coming up with one-off methods all
the time. DOM and JCR were two suggestions. i think longer term, that is what
should be done. this will also help to abstract the sitetree for publications
that have a different model (like the blog)
